website_summaries.verdict: The Magnavox TV100MW9 DTV converter box competently handles the basics, but doesn't offer a standout reason to choose it over its competitors.
cons: Remote is poorly designed and can't control a TV

customer_reviews.title: Magnavox was the original converter we had. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Magnavox was the original converter we had. I have learned that the converters have only a couple years life. When I replaced them with non-Magnavox units, they did not last as long. I will continue to get the Magnavox units as long as they are available.
customer_reviews.author: SocMom

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product, but I have had problems with Magnavox.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great (when it works). I am on my third unit. The first one lasted several years and provided good service. But one day it just went bezerk and only showed black and white lines dancing all over the screen. And none of the controls worked any more. It was out of warranty, so I bought a new one. That one lasted two months and did the same thing. Magnavox did not offer a warranty on it, but Amazon did give me a partial refund. So now I'm on the third one, and it is working fine. I'll give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ALAN J KNAPP

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Already had two of these that were purchased about five years ago and are still working, so decided to purchase one for our guest bedroom as we do not have cable. Plugged it in and it worked perfectly. Can pick up all the major local stations and their substations and pictures are clear. Receive about 35 stations total. Would recommend to anyone who doesn't have cable. Easy to attach and then just push the button to load the stations in your area.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Sent Item
customer_reviews.text: This seller advertised a new digital to analog converter box but it was actually a used box without it's accessories of the cable cord, the remote control/batteries, enclosed was two empty bags; the box itself had many smudges on it. Amazon.com did adjust the cost of the item to fit an used item without parts. I will never purchase from Victor's Discount again. I hate the experience of receiving and paying for something that is not what is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tehillah-Yaa'el Yisra'El

customer_reviews.title: save money
customer_reviews.text: Having this and a flat antenna saves paying satellite or cable company $200.00 or more in cost for services monthly. on just basic channels like local news channels, MeTv, This TV, Antenna TV, four OPB channels, Grit TV, ION channels, Retro, and GetTv. Channels keep getting added, I started with fourteen channels now up to twentytwo channels.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: The Magnavox digital converter does an excellent job switching analog signals to digital format
customer_reviews.text: The Magnavox digital converter does an excellent job switching analog signals to digital format. I am able to receive crystal clear signals and a wide range of channels using a simple color antenna. The Magnavox also includes additional features (electronic program guide; alternate channel; channel add/delete, etc.) that are a real plus. I tried other converters and returned them to the store. This one is for keeps.
customer_reviews.author: G.  Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not good forMe but maybe for someone with outside antenna
customer_reviews.text: This does not work but well in my area but my friend has an outside antenna and it works perfectly for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Dotson-Yowk

customer_reviews.title: Nice Box
customer_reviews.text: I like this convertor very much i hadn't hooked up the antenna and i had a good picture as my apartment faces the hancock and sears towers hold the antennas for most of our tv stations. I bought this for my bedroom as i dropped my comcast service as this was to expensive for watching reruns and mindless shows and movies.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: After some time with excellent display, this unit developed no sound for channel ...
customer_reviews.text: After some time with excellent display, this unit developed no sound for channel 5 & channel 7 specifically between 5 and 7 pm everyday. I purchased a second unit during the good display time and the second unit has developed the same condition. No thanks!
customer_reviews.author: ICM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It serves my purpose for what I need in helping my Tivo change channels via the IR blaster connection.
customer_reviews.author: Jani Fleet

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: On indoor rabbit ears, I get 2 main channels (from between 20 and 60 miles away) with 2 sub-channels each; grand total, 6. Can't wait to see how many I pull in when I get an outdoor antenna. The picture quality on an old analog TV is remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Used But Great Condition
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best converter I have found for our older televisions. Although I was hesitant to buy used, this unit was complete and worked extremely well. I would purchase from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: ChandlerLady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We were very glad to have a replacement converter so easily available. And it was inexpensive also.
customer_reviews.author: Julie L. Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and user friendly operation.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this converter box and found it to be great product. I have an older TV in my camper and did not want to go to the expense to purchase a new TV. Very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie41

customer_reviews.title: Escape from satellite bills!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a subscriber to one of the major satellite providers since 1990. The monthly fees have skyrocketed over the years. So I started looking into alternatives. Two years ago, I bought my first Magnavox converter box. I recently took it with me to Montana because my son was having reception issues. TV stations come in crystal clear in Montana and same for my home in Illinois. I recommend this converter box to everyone. I absolutely love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy A.

customer_reviews.title: Still doing analog
customer_reviews.text: Love this box. It works well and the box unlike my old one shuts off with the TV so no little green light on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Susan W

customer_reviews.title: I'm not happy with this purchase and may end up having to ...
customer_reviews.text: The box doesn't hold a signal very well. I'm constantly adjusting the antenna when I change channels. Or, the picture just blacks out for 5-8 seconds. The box came in original packaging, and didn't appear damaged. I'm not happy with this purchase and may end up having to buy another unit. NOT happy about THAT
customer_reviews.author: Laura Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Always works perfectly with a powered antenna. Brand new as stated in original box.
customer_reviews.author: D. Young

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: works great over 50 channels and free tv programs itself and is easy to use I have bought 3 units and recommended to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: We had a older TV that my son used in the playroom. For the price, it was good but limited features!!! However, beats buying a new tV.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Bowens

customer_reviews.title: ... thought it was but I returned it and was satisfied with the ease of the return
customer_reviews.text: It was not what I thought it was but I returned it and was satisfied with the ease of the return. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: jplambeck

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: useless The discriptions shows a remote and cords .It is very misleading you get a box with nothing else cannot program or anything.What a waste of time sitting around when I could just as well gone and spent money in store
customer_reviews.author: W. Stoner

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Received item, installed with no problem and it works fine. I don't know why review requires so many words, it is not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: BillMan

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: local walmart sells this box for $50. this was my first box. didn't know i'll have to use 2 remotes to watch tv. very annoying. guided setup was easy. picture quality was ok, sometimes choppy. remote is horrible. tiny buttons, requires 2 AA batteries. controls only channels. everything else must be controlled with tv remote. this box is very slow. going from one channel to another could take 6+ seconds to scan for signal. took it back, lost coupon. got a different brand box, very responsive, perfect reception with same antenna. this magnavox gets 1 star for being slow, poor reception, and ridiculous remote.
customer_reviews.author: guest

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at WalMart, because my coupon was about to expire and it was the only one they had. Couldn't try it out until today, because no station here was yet broadcasting in digital. I found that it will only work for about 30 seconds, then the TV set displays "no signal." If I shut it off and try again, it will not power up. If I shut it off for several hours, and try again, it works for 30 seconds again. The manual says the warranty does not cover labor except for the first 90 days after original purchase. WalMart will not refund the $40 from the coupon. I guess I bought a nice useless table ornament.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Z

customer_reviews.title: Basic box with recording problems and a tiny-button remote
customer_reviews.text: A very plain box that works ok except for lining into a VCR. Couldn't record with it. Setup was very easy. The remote has very tiny buttons and could be difficult to read/locate for some folks. Ended up buying two Radio Shack DTX9950 boxes after setting up one for my Mom. It was the easiest of the three that I've set up (I also tried the Insignia NS-DXA1, which I also reviewed on Amazon). Also had no reception or recording problems. And the remote is also the best of the three.
customer_reviews.author: steely_dan_phan

customer_reviews.title: By an RCA converter instead at Wal-mart
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Magnavox and an RCA converter at Wal-mart each for $50 minus the Government coupons final cost $10 each . The Magnavox is awful. The Remote control has tiny buttons and the unit has bad reception. The menu is just as bad. The RCA has a Remote control with large buttons and it will even control my TV's volume and power. The Reception is very good and signal strength meter for every channel. It has a channel list just like a Satellite receiver. Don't waste you money on the Magnavox (Funi) :-{ Buy the RCA instead!! :-}
customer_reviews.author: A. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to use
customer_reviews.text: You can buy this box at Wal-Mart for $50. All these converter boxes are annoying to use. The Magnavox TB100MW9 is no different: 1. You must use the crappy remote. 2. All digital signals should be mapped to analog channels so you can use your TV's remote with PiP. 3. You cannot set separate aspect ratios for each channel only for all channels. It does not automatically determine the best aspect ratio. 4. You cannot delete subchannels. Only the entire channel can be deleted.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Bought two - am taking both back
customer_reviews.text: One of the two converter boxes doesn't even power up. The other one does if you jiggle the cord --- sounds like a loose wire and lots of potential trouble. The one that did power up never found any channels and we are within good transmission range. I understand why these are no longer available -- they should be off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this box.
customer_reviews.text: The remote will NOT operate the volume on your TV. That means you'll have your converter box remote in one hand to change the channel and your TV remote in the other to change the volume.The remote buttons are tiny and difficult to push. You have to be directly in front of the box in order for the remote to talk to the box. Also there is no way to delete a station you don't have any interest in...so you're forced to scroll through ALL the channels when surfing. Other than that...it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Same as Walmart
customer_reviews.text: This is the same model you can get at Walmart for $50.00. With government coupon worth $40.00 it only cost a little over $11.00 out of pocket with tax. Don't see any reason to buy here. Walmart is everywhere. Magnavox is fairly good. It has alot of nice features which, others have mentioned. My problem is having rabbit ears I can't get good reception now with the box attached to the rabbit ears and I think that would probably be the same with any converter box I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rodney

customer_reviews.title: I have 2!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy does the trick. I get 13 channels that are @ least if not 50 + miles away and further. I only used to get around6-8 channels but then bought a this when the conversion came around and it made a huge difference. It is also a bonus if you buy a pair of the rabbit ears that are actually powered by an AC plug-in to the wall. The signal strength makes it jump from around 20-23 to upwards of around 55-61 percent.
customer_reviews.author: chapa

customer_reviews.title: Funai Magnavox TB100MW9 digital to analog converter
customer_reviews.text: Went to local WM and bought their best antenna, a RCA that looks like a 4' boomerang at $59. Bought their only brand of converter, made in China, using a $40 U.S. government coupon. After much trial & error I can get all the local stations that are within 20 miles, but none 30 or 35 miles away. Was only able to do this by removing the antenna's in-line amp, buying 75' of RG-6 cable and mounting the antenna 10' above roof. With in-line amp I get only two channels. The channels I do get are perfect. Pressing EPG brings up only a banner of the current program, not a guide. Remote buttons are small. Suggest waiting to order coupon.
customer_reviews.author: Buford T Justice

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I only use this brand as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I only use this brand as the RCA ones are terrible to use and don't scan and pick up channels this one does. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good Box with limitations
customer_reviews.text: Although I was able to receive more channnels with this box than a competitors box, I was surprised with this model that there is not an on/off switch on the box and that you cannnot change channels without the use of the remote. I wonder how useful this box will be if you lose the remote or if the remote stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Krum

customer_reviews.title: not one channel
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up to the cable wire as shown in booklet.. did the autoscan - did NOT pull in even one channel - and I even tried it with a channel amp too. Total garbage
customer_reviews.author: Use2play

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and affordable TV Converter Box!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased two of these. This was one of the least expensive converter boxes at the stores I shopped. Very easy to setup. Good brand name. Most importantly works on both of my older TVs with no problems. I have been using them for about 2 weeks and seems like a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brock S

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with most universal remotes. Doesn't have volume controls on the remote. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Striegel

customer_reviews.title: Antenna Needed ~ Not for Cable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from my local superstore and didn't bother to read the box. You need either an indoor antenna or an over the air antenna to use this particular converter box. IT DOES NOT WORK WITH CABLE
customer_reviews.author: ashtonhouse

product_meta.title: Magnavox DTV Digital to Analog Converter tb100mw9
product_meta.description: Digital converter boxes receive over-the-air digital TV broadcasts for viewing on TVs that do not have built-in digital tuners. If you wish to keep using your analog TV set, you must purchase a digital converter box. Digital converter boxes are available at Wal-Mart stores nationwide. For additional information and to apply for digital converter box coupons, visit www.dtv2009.gov or call 1-888-DTV-2009. This box receives over-the-air digital TV broadcasts for viewing on a TV that does not have a built-in digital (ATSC) tuner. Additional features include a trilingual on-screen display, audio/video output, antenna input (F-type connector), and remote control.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars72 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
